title: Luisa Dias Diogo former Prime Minister Mozambique

quotes: Prime Minister of Mozambique (2004-2010)
Luisa Dias Diogo is a former Prime Minister of Mozambique (2004- 2010).
Luisa Dias Diogo was Prime Minister of Mozambique from 2004 to 2010.
Luisa Dias Diogo received her B.A. in Economics from Maputo’s Eduardo Mondlane University in 1983,
a Master’s degree in Financial Economics from the School of Oriental and African Studies (University of London) in 1992.
Before becoming Prime Minister in her country, she served as Minister of Planning and Finance for five years.
Diogo was recognized by the Times Magazine in 2004, as one of the hundred most influential people in the world;
by the Forbes Magazine as one of the hundred most powerful women in the world, for two consecutive years (2006 and 2008).
